Menu

Add ingredients: kale. quinoa.

Rice: cilantro lime rice. white rice. brown rice

Beans: black beans. pinto beans. curried chick peas

Salsa: mango salsa. pico de gallo. corn salsa

Toppings: blue cheese celery slaw. house made hummus. Almond. sherbed croutons. rice noodles. sesame seeds. jack cheese. feta cheese. sour cream

Dressings: skinny mediterranean vinaigrette. creamy lime dressing. asian vinaigrette. blue cheese dressing. balsamic dressing. caesar dressing. ranch dressing

Veggies: bok choy. asian slaw. romaine lettuce. Cucumber. Broccoli. Celery. caramelized onions. shredded carrots. scallions

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: I am a resident freshman, what are my meal plan options?
A: All freshmen are required to contract for the Super Value Meal Plan or the Value 15 Meal Plan.

Q: I am an upperclassman living in an on-campus residence hall/suite, what are my meal plan options?
A: All on-campus hall/suite residents are required to contract for the Super Value, Value 15, or Value 12 Meal Plans.

Q: I live in an apartment, what are my meal plan options?
A: Residents of both on and off campus apartments are eligible for any of the meal plans. Super Value, Value 15, Value 10, APARTMENT Plan or the BLOCK 60 Plan.

Q: What are the meal plan block-out dates?
A: Meal plans are not in effect during Thanksgiving, Semester, and Spring Breaks.

Q: What if I want to make a change to meal plan?
A: The date for the fall semester deadline for residents of mandatory meal plan areas to lower their meal plan is September 22. The date for the spring semester deadline for residents of mandatory meal plan areas to lower their meal plan is February 2, 2017. Any changes made after these dates must be completed in person at the Residential Center. Residents of any area can increase or add a meal plan at any time.

Q: What is the difference between Discretionary Dollars and Falcon Funds?
A: Discretionary Dollars are part of the Meal Plan. They may only be used to purchase food at Campus Dining locations (except Dunkin Donuts). Falcon Funds are money that you personally add to your Falcon Fund account. They may be used on campus like a debit card. Falcon Funds are accepted at the bookstore, student information desk and all campus dining locations.
